explanation.text:
Explanation
Given the molecular formula, \(CH_{2}\).
The empirical formula will be \((CH_{2})n\)= 42
\((12+(2\times1))n =42\)
⇒ \(14n =42\)
n = 3, hence the empirical formula is \(C_{3}H_{6}\)

\(V_{A} = \frac{0.3 \times 25 \times 2}{0.1 \times 1}\)
\(V_{A} = 150cm^{3}\)

explanation.text:
Explanation
1g of Hydrocarbon = 0.93g of Carbon, therefore, Hydrogen = (1 - 0.93)g = 0.07g
    C       :      H
0.93       :      0.07
\(\frac{0.93}{12}\)   :   \(\frac{0.07}{1}\)
0.078         :        0.07
\(\frac{0.078}{0.07}    :    \frac{0.07}{0.07}\)
\(\approxeq   1:1\)

where n= (1,2,3,...)

Relative molecular mass = (30 x n)
From the options, only 180 is a multiple of 30, when n=6.
